messages: 3c1a153d81002878b83df957ee534f47 (01:53): d5f549c13db7f29a9f9c330876295a67 - so these are non-HTML rel values?
3c1a153d81002878b83df957ee534f47 (01:53): (just to be clear)
d5f549c13db7f29a9f9c330876295a67 (01:56): yes, applied to an XML media type
d5f549c13db7f29a9f9c330876295a67 (01:56): i recall "collection" as a rel value in the past, but was not able to find any active ref to it.
3c1a153d81002878b83df957ee534f47 (01:56): ok that makes sense
3c1a153d81002878b83df957ee534f47 (01:58): d5f549c13db7f29a9f9c330876295a67 - are you looking for feedback on your proposed rel values?
d5f549c13db7f29a9f9c330876295a67 (01:58): feel free to suggest edits/mods as you see fit.
3c1a153d81002878b83df957ee534f47 (01:58): the directional rel values are interesting
3c1a153d81002878b83df957ee534f47 (01:58): and seem to make sense
3c1a153d81002878b83df957ee534f47 (01:58): however the use of "collection" and "maze" don't make sense IMHO as rel values
3c1a153d81002878b83df957ee534f47 (01:59): because they are not relative relations to the current document
3c1a153d81002878b83df957ee534f47 (01:59): e.g. rel="collection" to me would mean a collection of things in which the current resource is a member/item of the collection
3c1a153d81002878b83df957ee534f47 (01:59): rel is not for arbitrary tagging
3c1a153d81002878b83df957ee534f47 (01:59): e.g. we've already rejected rel="nsfw"
3c1a153d81002878b83df957ee534f47 (01:59): for that reason
d5f549c13db7f29a9f9c330876295a67 (02:00): understood
3c1a153d81002878b83df957ee534f47 (02:00): so rel="maze" meaning "this is a maze" - that's an abuse of rel
d5f549c13db7f29a9f9c330876295a67 (02:00): your collection def works for my particular case, i think.
d5f549c13db7f29a9f9c330876295a67 (02:00): i understand that "maze" is not
3c1a153d81002878b83df957ee534f47 (02:00): for indicating that the target of a link is a specific type of thing, use the "type" attribute with the mime type of the destination
3c1a153d81002878b83df957ee534f47 (02:01): e.g. instead of <a href rel="maze"> I think you want <a href type="application/maze+xml">
d5f549c13db7f29a9f9c330876295a67 (02:01): the representation will always be in maze+xml
d5f549c13db7f29a9f9c330876295a67 (02:02): but clients can follow links to locate particular "things" or "places"
d5f549c13db7f29a9f9c330876295a67 (02:02): not sure "type" is approp, but some "name" or "class" equiv might be better
d5f549c13db7f29a9f9c330876295a67 (02:02): but i see your point
3c1a153d81002878b83df957ee534f47 (02:03): well, rel="maze" is certainly not right for that
3c1a153d81002878b83df957ee534f47 (02:03): but I'm not sure what is
3c1a153d81002878b83df957ee534f47 (02:03): better to collect some use-cases to figure it oiut
3c1a153d81002878b83df957ee534f47 (02:03): rather than proposing the value
d5f549c13db7f29a9f9c330876295a67 (02:03): i use these in a currently reg'd type that has a handful of sample clients.
d5f549c13db7f29a9f9c330876295a67 (02:04): very small footprint and a vnd type
d5f549c13db7f29a9f9c330876295a67 (02:04): proly make sense to remove the "maze" from the list
d5f549c13db7f29a9f9c330876295a67 (02:05): if i mod the def for collection to read as you suggest...
d5f549c13db7f29a9f9c330876295a67 (02:05): would be make more sense?
d5f549c13db7f29a9f9c330876295a67 (02:05): or should that be removed, too?
3c1a153d81002878b83df957ee534f47 (02:10): either would be fine (revise or remove collection)
3c1a153d81002878b83df957ee534f47 (02:10): and yes, drop rel="maze" accordingly
